info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 04 at 5:48PM CDT until November 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HOPKINS...NORTHEASTERN DELTA AND SOUTHEASTERN LAMAR COUNTIES... At 547 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 11 miles northeast of Cooper Lake State Park, or 13 miles west of Hagansport, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Pattonville, Deport, Tira, Taylor Town, Nelta, Clardy, Milton, Cunningham and Minter. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows.
